intro: Symbolanthus quelchii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with hairy stems and opposite leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands and rocky areas. Symbolanthus quelchii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
